intro: Dimorphanthes bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often lobed or toothed, giving it the specific epithet "bidentata." Dimorphanthes bidentata is often found in coastal or inland dune ecosystems, where it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
